quiz.text: Which of the following organization has released the ‘7th Logistics Performance Index (LPI)?
options: Institute for Economics and Peace
World Bank
World Trade Organization
World Economic Forum
United Nations Conference on Trade and Development

quiz.text: According to recently released “7th Logistic Performance Index (LPI): Connecting to Compete 2023”, India has been ranked at ______ place.
options: 54th
47th
38th
48th
52nd

quiz.text: According to recently released “7th Logistic Performance Index (LPI): Connecting to Compete 2023”, which of the following countries has been ranked at the top in LPI?
options: Singapore
Denmark
Finland
Estonia
Turkiye

quiz.text: According to recently released “7th Logistic Performance Index (LPI): Connecting to Compete 2023”, which of the following is not one of the indicators used to assess the countries?
options: Tracking and Tracing
Infrastructure
The ease of arranging competitively priced domestic shipments
Customs & Border Management
Logistics competence and quality

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations has released the report “Promoting Millets in Diets: Best Practices across States/UTs of India”?
options: Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO)
NITI Aayog
ICAR-Central Institute of Agricultural Engineering, Bhopal
1 and 2
1 and 3

quiz.text: According to recently released “Promoting Millets in Diets: Best Practices across States/UTs of India” report, India produces ________ commonly known traditional millets.
options: Five
Seven
Six
Eight
Nine

quiz.text: According to recently released “Promoting Millets in Diets: Best Practices across States/UTs of India” report, millets were made part of the National Food Security Mission (NFSM) in which of the following years?
options: 2018
2004
2013
2009
2020

quiz.text:
Which among the following is/are the theme(s) under the report “Promoting Millets in Diets: Best Practices across States/UTs of India”?

A.     State Missions and initiatives to promote Millets.

B.      Inclusion of millets in ICDS.

C.      Research and development and use of technology for innovative practices.
options: A and B
B and C
A and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with regards to the National Health Accounts Estimate 2019-20?

A.     The report is released biennially.

B.      ‘NHAE 2019-20’ is the 5th edition.

C.      It is based on World Health Organization framework of System of Health Accounts, 2014.
options: A and B
B and C
C only
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: According to recently released “National Health Accounts Estimate 2019-20”, the share of Out-of-Pocket Expenditure (OOPE) in total Health Expenditure (THE) has __________ from 62.6% (2014-15) to _______ (2019-20).
options: increased; 64.7%
declined; 48.8%
declined; 47.1%
declined; 58.7%
declined; 48.2%

quiz.text: According to recently released “National Health Accounts Estimate 2019-20”, in per capita terms, Government Health Expenditure (GHE) has increased from Rs 1,108 to ________ between 2014-25 to 2019-20.
options: Rs 1,454
Rs 1,814
Rs 2,219
Rs 2,863
Rs 2,014

quiz.text: According to recently released “National Health Accounts Estimate 2019-20”, the share of Government Health Expenditure (GHE) in the overall GDP of the country has increased from 1.13% in 2014-15 to ________ in 2019-20.
options: 1.35%
1.22%
1.28%
1.41%
1.18%

quiz.text: Which of the following entities has released the report “The State of the World’s Children 2023: For Every Child, Vaccination”?
options: World Health Organization
UNICEF India
Médecins Sans Frontières (Doctors Without Borders)
Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
1 and 4

quiz.text: According to recently released “The State of the World’s Children 2023: For Every Child, Vaccination” report, in the poorest households, ________ children are zero-dose while in the wealthiest, it is just 1 in 20.
options: 1 in 10
1 in 15
1 in 5
1 in 12
1 in 14

quiz.text: According to recently released “The State of the World’s Children 2023: For Every Child, Vaccination” report, the popular perception of the importance of vaccines for children held firm or improved only in ___________ out of 55 countries studied.
options: India, Sri Lanka and Indonesia
India and China
India, China and Mexico
China, India and Germany
Sweden and Finland

quiz.text: According to recently released “The State of the World’s Children 2023: For Every Child, Vaccination” report, the number of children paralysed by polio was ________ year-on-year in 2022.
options: up 8 per cent
up 2 per cent
down 2 per cent
up 16 per cent
down 8 per cent

quiz.text: Which among the following organizations has recently released the “Technology and Innovation Report 2023”?
options: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development
World Bank
NITI Aayog
World Economic Forum

quiz.text: According to recently released “Technology and Innovation Report 2023”, green technologies can create a market worth _______ by 2030.
options: USD 5 trillion
USD 9.5 trillion
USD 6.5 trillion
USD 5.5 trillion

quiz.text: “Technology and Innovation Report 2023” assesses countries’ preparedness for frontier technologies and presents a “readiness index” ranking 166 countries. India is ranked at what position in the “readiness index”?
options: 40th
35th
46th
56th
25th

quiz.text: “Technology and Innovation Report 2023” assesses countries’ preparedness for frontier technologies and presents a “readiness index” ranking 166 countries based on five “building blocks. Which of the following is not one of the building blocks to assess countries?
options: ICT Deployment
Enforcement of Intellectual Property Rights
Skills
Access to Finance
Industry Activity

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with regards to the “First Census of Water Bodies in India”?
options: It has been released by Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change.
The census covers only natural water bodies.
It has been launched under Central Sponsored Scheme “Jal Jeevan Mission”.
It covers all the water bodies located in rural areas only.
None of the above

quiz.text: According to recently released “First Census of Water Bodies in India”, which among the following water bodies type constitute the highest percentage in terms of numbers?

Ponds
Reservoirs
Lakes
Check Dams

quiz.text: According to recently released “First Census of Water Bodies in India”, what percentage of water bodies are man-made?
options: 22%

78%%
64%

options: New York, USA
